programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Côte d'Opale, from the cliffs of the Deux-Caps to the wetlands of Saint-Omer Appreciated for the beauty of its landscapes and the 120 km of its beaches that stretch from the Belgian coast to the Somme Bay, the Côte d'Opale offers natural wonders and surprising gastronomic specialities. Montreuillois, Saint-Omer, Boulonnais... Here corners of nature remain unspoilt and the scenery is simply grandiose. Directed by: Florent Quet (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Landes, an autumn full of life Autumn in the Landes is a sacred season for many of the local people. And for good cause, here nature offers an abundance of activities to enjoy at this magical time of year. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Louis helps out at the house of someone who has involuntarily sheltered pigeons, squirrels and an entire family of raccoons.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A little trip to Charlevoix Christian heads off to meet friends on the other side of the river, in the delightful region of Charlevoix. Pioneer in making the most of its terroir in terms of food, it offers a unique culinary trail under the expert guidance of the top chef Jean Soulard. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les profits grandissants des grandes chaînes d'alimentation
programme.desc:
Ever-higher profits for the major supermarket chains
Are supermarket chains using inflation as an excuse to increase their profits? We investigate... Also on the programme: how to reduce your bill at the supermarket check-out; all about tamarind, a strange fruit that bring a touch of acidity; and a delicatessen meat from eastern Europe, the kielbasa.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Hautes-Pyrénées, from the Sanctuary in Lourdes to the Pic du Midi observatory The Hautes-Pyrénées, where nature still dictates its law. From the sanctuary in Lourdes, drawing millions of pilgrims, to Arreau, a village renowned for its 16th century town hall-covered market, the Pic du Midi with its promise of exceptional nights under the stars, and the Gaude Lake, reflecting the majestic peaks. Directed by: Isabelle Le Guen (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Basque country inland, a land of passions In a region of breathtaking landscapes, Éric Perrin sets off to meet some of those born and bred here, living between age-old tradition and modern renewal. A journey that begins with a hike along the legendary Iparla Ridge, where pottock ponies, sheep and vultures are never far away. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Beaverton, Ontario
Louis discovers some chipmunks in the basement of a house and a client asks for his help to remove a skunk from his garden shed.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Young chefs from Asia Bringing together young chefs and artisans of Chinese origin is the ideal way to concoct a menu with authentic Chinese dishes. A young generation certain to surprise with their creativity. And it's the actress Cynthia Wu-Maheux who's lucky enough to make the most of the result! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Treats for dogs
The pandemic saw a rise in the number of pets being adopted. Result: the range of products on offer also increased! But how to make the right choice? Also on the programme: different types of Asian sauces, a focus on Indian bread and the range of crèmes caramel now available.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Hautes-Pyrénées, from the Sanctuary in Lourdes to the Pic du Midi observatory The Hautes-Pyrénées, where nature still dictates its law. From the sanctuary in Lourdes, drawing millions of pilgrims, to Arreau, a village renowned for its 16th century town hall-covered market, the Pic du Midi with its promise of exceptional nights under the stars, and the Gaude Lake, reflecting the majestic peaks. programme.title: Jardins et loisirs
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Haute Tarentaise, land of extremes We set off to explore the Haute Tarentaise, a high alpine valley in the far reaches of the Savoie. This impressive setting, surrounded by glaciers, towering peaks and mountain passes rendered impassable in winter, is home to a wide range of extreme sports. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Séduire les employés... par le ventre
programme.desc:
The way to an employee's heart... through their stomach?
Does offering employees attractive meal options make good economic sense? Also on the programme: testing hand mixers; discovering ajvar, Balkan caviar; and a cake from Transylvania.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Atlantic islands, from the Vendée to the Charente-Maritime An exploration of five Atlantic islands offering authenticity at its best. Between the Charente-Maritime and the Vendée, for a journey beginning on the radiant island of Oléron, continuing to the Vendée isles of Yeu and Noirmoutier, before ending with two particularly unspoilt beauty spots, the islands of Aix and Madame. Directed by: François Chayé (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Basque country inland, a land of passions In a region of breathtaking landscapes, Éric Perrin sets off to meet some of those born and bred here, living between age-old tradition and modern renewal. A journey that begins with a hike along the legendary Iparla Ridge, where pottock ponies, sheep and vultures are never far away. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: A contemporary Q-Zen house We head to Lasne to discover a house half-way between sculpture and architecture: the Q-Zen house and its particularly strict ecological and energy-saving requirements. Also on the programme: up-cycling with Namufacture; La Siroperie, a holiday home in Antheit, and how to make a log store. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Maremne and the Marensin
We head for the regions of La Maremne and Le Marensin, where Thomas picks asparagus and strawberries growing in the sandy Landes soil. Between vines and cellar Alan's wines keep him fully occupied. All about the Landes pastis and local actions in favour of the climate.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Flavigny: its aniseed, history and regional identity Flavigny-sur-Ozerain is considered as one of France's finest villages. The municipality, whose narrow streets are brimming with architectural treasures dating from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, delights passers-by and occasional visitors. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest

A journey that begins with a hike along the legendary Iparla Ridge, where pottock ponies, sheep and vultures are never far away. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Special feature on fashion design
Identity and change, haute couture's relationship to all aspects of fashion design with Stéphane Rolland. Gloves are more than a useful accessory: we meet the Swedish glove maker Thomasine Barnekow. Mugler, Dior, Chanel, Schiaparelli... Michel Carel goes behind-the-scenes to showcase the great designers' most extravagant ideas.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Patrick Jeffroy
In the Finistère, we meet the Breton chef Patrick Jeffroy and his disciples. This indomitable Gaul invites us to discover the unique people and ingredients that made him a Michelin-starred chef, all set against the spectacular background of the Brittany coast.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in a geodesic dome Julien meets Mark and Chris on Gambier Island, where the two friends and professional skiers live in a geodesic dome. Julien gives them a hand with some of their on-going projects. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Manche, from the northern Cotentin to Mont-Saint-Michel Lush, green and steeped in natural beauty, the Manche also regales its visitors with Viking tales. In the northern Cotentin, fishing ports, memorial sites and biscuit-makers await the traveller. Further south, Chausey lobsters are guaranteed to have your mouth-watering, before you head off to explore Mont-Saint-Michel Bay. Directed by: Florent Quet (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Basque country inland, a land of passions In a region of breathtaking landscapes, Éric Perrin sets off to meet some of those born and bred here, living between age-old tradition and modern renewal. programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Shortbread, clafoutis and chocolate clusters
For a speedy solution when you need a sugar fix, Ricardo presents three recipes that only take a few minutes and a single bowl to prepare: chocolate shortbread biscuits, cherry clafoutis and chocolate-coated blueberry-hazelnut clusters
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.
